I'm a person who loves to encourage people to write more samurai fiction. S=
o this contest works wonders for this. And I liked the different categories=
. And you gave plenty of notice as far as deadlines.

Suggestions: 

1) Cla=
rify the issue about stories that are sequels or prequels to an author's pr=
evious contest story. Either allow such stories, as long as the prequel/seq=
uel can stand completely as an independent story. Or else make a rule that =
a writer cannot write a story about any character who was in any of his/her=
 previous years' entries.

2) You might want to allow a writer to enter mor=
e than one story, as long as each of an entrant's stories are in a differen=
t category.  

3) I would make at least a suggestion that, as this is the "=
SAMURAI Fiction Contest", that the main character of any story actually be =
a samurai. Or else, if the POV character isn't a samurai, that the story ce=
nters on some sort of samurai character. I realize that in earlier eras of =
Japanese history, that samurai didn't exist as a distinct, separate class. =
So for these stories, it should center on a person who would perform a role=
 that a samurai would perform i.e. fight in battles or studies a martial ar=
t.

Just a few comments and suggestions. These contests are a lot of fun an=
d I look forward to the 2007 Samurai Fiction Competition.

Nina Boal
